author: Kevin Maguire
title: Jeremy Hunt proves he needs a sick note by scrapping A&E four hour targets
text:
News Opinion Jeremy Hunt proves he needs a sick note by scrapping A&E four hour targets The Health Secretary said the long-standing pledge to treat every A&E patient within a four-hour window should now apply to “urgent” cases only Share Jeremy Hunt has made a statement in the Commons Share Get politics   Could   
Jeremy Hunt’s a quack doctor writing himself a sick note. 
The hapless Health Secretary isn’t up to the job when he’s scrapping the important four-hour A&E pledge. 
In its hour of need the NHS cries out for a strong leader to save and revive an ailing service. 
Instead it’s lumbered with a lame duck busily fiddling the statistics - an admission of defeat by a useless Tory who must be held responsible for his disaster. 
Hunt failed to inject money and stupidly shut hospital beds when demand was growing, an older population needing and deserved to be looked after. Read More Hospitals are at breaking point (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Demoralised junior doctors were driven to strike while fed up GPs quit by the surgery full. 
Then there’s the £4bn slashed from social care which adds to A&E pressures when the vulnerable and confused are ferried to the only place open. 
And let’s remember the £3bn wasted by Tories on a bureaucratic upheaval to slice the NHS into juicy pieces ripe for privatisation. 
Relaxing waiting times to hit targets is political alchemy which won’t make better our precious service. 
Deciding who is and isn’t an emergent case is a stroke of a pen when what’s required are more doctors, nurses and medical staff. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
